snippet: Webb Simpson leads the Wells Fargo Championship by a shot, but Rory McIlroy, the No. 2-ranked player in the world, is two strokes behind.
abstract: Webb Simpson takes third-round lead at the Wells Fargo Championship golf tournament, but Rory McIlroy, two strokes behind, might be in the best position heading into the final round. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- Although he's not in the lead, Rory McIlroy might be in the best position heading into Sunday's final round of the Wells Fargo Championship. After shooting a six-under-par 66 in the third round Saturday at the Quail Hollow Club, McIlroy, the reigning United States Open champion and the No. 2-ranked player in the world, is two strokes behind the local favorite and leader Webb Simpson and a stroke behind two other players. After his round, McIlroy was asked if being so close to the lead might unnerve some of his competitors.

headline.main: Alone in the Lead, Simpson Glances Over His Shoulder
